intro: Lanonia poilanei, commonly known as the Madagascar lantern plant, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, lantern-shaped inflorescences. The plant features palmate leaves with a velvety texture and produces vibrant yellow-orange flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
